name: NPR
text:
The presidential election underscored deep divisions in U.S. society.

We want to hear from you: Where does the country go from here? How do you think Americans can move forward as a nation?

Please fill out this form, and we may be in touch for a story.
https://t.co/HloizCAkWG

name: NPR
text:
On the same day that Pfizer announced early good news about its coronavirus vaccine, its CEO sold $5.6 million worth of company stock as its value skyrocketed.

That has raised serious questions about what he knew and when.
 https://t.co/JOTeFAngAn

name: NPR
text:
JUST IN: President-elect Joe Biden has named Ron Klain, a longtime Democratic consultant, as his chief of staff. Klain previously served as President Obama's Ebola czar.
https://t.co/sPomfnU90Q

name: NPR
text:
President-elect Biden has pledged to accept as many as 125,000 refugees a year ‚Äî after the Trump White House slashed the resettlement program, setting a record-low cap of 15,000.

Here's a look at some of the challenges that await.
https://t.co/Md0UhFz01M

name: NPR
text:
Emily Harrington climbed her way into the history books last week, becoming the first woman to free-climb the Golden Gate route of Yosemite National Park's El Capitan in less than a day.
https://t.co/BTNDvWyQML

name: NPR
text:
Texas has now recorded more than 1 million coronavirus cases, according to Johns Hopkins University data. The state accounts for about 10% of all U.S. cases.
https://t.co/3sqltYdACC

name: NPR
text:
Census data suggest a larger number of men are spending more time at home. One dad gets emotional thinking about how much he's missed ‚Äî and how much he's experiencing now working from home.

"Even with all the chaos, this has been a bonus year for me." https://t.co/fThXqw5lsI

name: NPR
text:
For five decades, NorthPoint Health & Wellness Center in Minneapolis has confronted the ways that racial disparities can hurt its patients' health. 

Community leaders say it's a model for cities facing similar struggles.
https://t.co/RG817aXI47

name: NPR
text:
Nearly 1 in 5 patients diagnosed with COVID-19 is diagnosed with a psychiatric disorder within 3 months, a new study finds. The relationship is bidirectional:

People with psychiatric diagnoses were about 65% more likely to be diagnosed with COVID-19. https://t.co/x6TMLdGOx3

name: NPR
text:
Joseph Robertson was an Army infantryman, and fought at the Battle of the Bulge, the largest and bloodiest battle fought by the U.S. during World War II. 

He told @StoryCorps about a memory from the battle that haunted him for the rest of his life. https://t.co/vacwBQbTO0

name: NPR
text:
The U.S., U.K., E.U., Canada, and Japan have already claimed over 80% of Pfizer's coronavirus vaccine supply for 2021.

That means it likely won't be available to folks in poorer countries, "at least, by the end of next year," a global health expert says. 
https://t.co/CyIbVYA4mG

name: NPR
text: The brand new National Museum Of The U.S. Army has some amazing artifacts, but the star of the show is the focus on individual soldier stories and the stunning visual representation of the Army's role in life and war ‚Äî the good, bad, and ugly. @wamu885 https://t.co/uOCJTYAQVZ

name: NPR
text:
In this special quarantine Tiny Desk concert, watch award-winning pianist Tigran Hamasyan perform three songs from his home in Armenia.
https://t.co/NK7xW41Ezo

name: NPR
text:
Several YouTube accounts live-streamed fake election results to huge audiences on Election Day.

One came from a public YouTube channel with over 650,000 followers and was one of Google's Top 5 results for vote tallies in swing states on Tuesday night.
https://t.co/wjOZsYvPIh

name: NPR
text:
"We framed this virus and compared it to monsters that have plagued our people, in our creation stories, our traditional stories. The Navajo people have fought monsters throughout time," the Navajo Nation president said.
https://t.co/ysbznYpeDZ

name: NPR
text:
UPS will allow drivers to grow beards after years of strict rules on personal appearance. The delivery giant said it wanted to make employees "feel comfortable, genuine and authentic."
https://t.co/KhcB0fij1H

name: NPR
text: If you need a blueprint for how to spend the next wave of quarantine, you could do worse than the sweet refrain of rising R&B star Tiana Major9's "Thinking About You." Her Tiny Desk shows off her timbre and range. https://t.co/duy4FBlHhy

name: NPR
text: Meet the humble atheist who fought the state of Kentucky for four years to get the license plate he wanted: "IM GOD": "I believe in the First Amendment -- that's the most sacred thing that was ever written." @WKMS https://t.co/aFtsATCVzK

name: NPR
text:
More than 10.4 million coronavirus infections have been confirmed in the U.S.

Here's a look at how much cases are up compared with 2 weeks ago:
üìà North Dakota: +58%
üìà South Dakota: +28%
üìà Iowa: +201%
üìà Wisconsin: +50%
üìà Wyoming: +89%
https://t.co/oAs81jpwpk

name: NPR
text:
Britain and the European Union have condemned China's move to disqualify four pro-democracy lawmakers in Hong Kong ‚Äî an action that sparked the mass resignation of the opposition in the city's legislature.
https://t.co/DaOI3ceXLh

name: NPR
text:
Obama's ascent thrilled millions of people, but it also stirred a counter-movement that's still on the march.

His new memoir covers his rise through the second year of his presidency ‚Äî and doesn't spare readers the controversies that studded those years.
https://t.co/R9ECxCCKca

name: NPR
text:
.@HowIBuiltThis host @GuyRaz is LIVE with the founder of the largest gang-intervention and rehabilitation program in the world ‚Äî @HomeBoyInd.

Watch Guy's live interview with Father Greg Boyle ‚Äì and share what's on your mind!

Supported by @Square. https://t.co/xrzP0cCfqj

name: NPR
text:
President-elect Biden's plan to lower the eligibility age for Medicare is popular among voters, but it's expected to face strong opposition from Republicans ‚Äî and from hospitals.
https://t.co/S3Lboch1R1

name: NPR
text: RT @keratx: Jeffress, a supporter of Donald Trump since before he won the presidency in 2016, called Biden's victory a "bitter pill to swallow" in a column for Fox News' website. He went on to write ‚Äúhere is our chance to show that Christians are not hypocrites.‚Äù https://t.co/7O0rOSBKS2 https://t.co/s7GHTXsTIr

name: NPR
text: RT @CPRNews: ‚ÄúRestaurant owners are scared to death about what's going to happen this winter.‚Äù https://t.co/EPckedANBz

name: NPR
text:
RT @laurelwamsley: A new study found that nearly 1 in 5 people diagnosed with COVID-19 is diagnosed with mental illness within 3 months.

I spoke with one of the authors and a psychologist working with post-COVID patients to get the story behind the numbers.

https://t.co/xcBpwvzM01

name: NPR
text:
A federal appeals court in Boston has ruled Harvard doesn't intentionally discriminate against Asian-American applicants in its admissions process.
https://t.co/4KYK2dnmM0

name: NPR
text:
Wearing a mask protects the wearer ‚Äî not just other people ‚Äî from the coronavirus, the CDC emphasized in an updated report issued Tuesday.
https://t.co/qo8u0SHKsV

name: NPR
text:
Tropical Storm Eta made landfall for the fourth time when it hit Florida's coast. It's expected to drop another 1-3 inches of rain across parts of the peninsula on Thursday, the National Hurricane Center says.
https://t.co/IjO4CEob4N
